inspectVersion.description: If set, fork-version will print the current version and exit.

files.description: List of the files to be updated.

glob.description: Glob pattern to match files to be updated.

path.description: The path fork-version will run from. Defaults to "process.cwd()".

changelog.description: Name of the changelog file. Defaults to "CHANGELOG.md".

header.description: The header text for the changelog.

tagPrefix.description: Specify a prefix for the created tag. Defaults to "v".

preRelease.description: Make a pre-release with optional label if given value is a string.

currentVersion.description: If set, fork-version will use this version instead of trying to determine one.

nextVersion.description: If set, fork-version will attempt to update to this version, instead of incrementing using "conventional-commit".

allowMultipleVersions.description: Don't throw an error if multiple versions are found in the given files.

commitAll.description: Commit all changes, not just files updated by fork-version.

dryRun.description: No output will be written to disk or committed.

silent.description: Run without logging to the terminal.

gitTagFallback.description: If unable to find a version in the given files, fallback and attempt to use the latest git tag. Defaults to true.

sign.description: If true, git will sign the commit with the systems GPG key.

verify.description: If true, git will run user defined git hooks before committing.

type.description: The type of commit message, such as "feat", "fix", "chore".

scope.description: The scope of the commit message.

section.description: The section of the `CHANGELOG` the commit should show up in.

hidden.description: Should show in the generated changelog message?

types.description: List of explicitly supported commit message types.

commitUrlFormat.description: A URL representing a specific commit at a hash.

compareUrlFormat.description: A URL representing the comparison between two git SHAs.

issueUrlFormat.description: A URL representing the issue format.

userUrlFormat.description: A URL representing a user's profile on GitHub, Gitlab, etc.

releaseCommitMessageFormat.description: A string to be used to format the auto-generated release commit message.

issuePrefixes.description: List of prefixes used to detect references to issues.

releaseMessageSuffix.description: Add a suffix to the release commit message.
